description: pro- (“front”) +‎ soma (“body”), from Ancient Greek σῶμα (sôma, “body”).

entries.meaning: (zoology) The front segment of a body which is divided into two or more segments, especially the cephalothorax of an arachnid or crustacean.
examples: The front part, called the cephalothorax (or prosoma), is enclosed within a relatively hard and unyielding chitinous shell.
